name: Carter Rabasa
bio: Carter is the Founder of CascadiaJS. He loves to write code, play with his kids and take his labradoodle Otto on walks.

name: Carrie Rabasa
bio: Logo and brand identity designer. Mom to two amazing kids, one dog, many plants, and a sourdough starter.

name: Quinn Rabasa
bio: Kid coder, artist and animator, loves to play with his dog Otto!

name: Emily Rabasa
bio: Jewelry maker, Roblox player and amazing baker!

name: Aaron Turner
bio: Aaron Turner is a senior engineer at Fastly. They were previously doing rad stuff at Google and various startups and agencies. In their spare time, they are hacking on various WebAssembly projects on the web, cooking up some dope beats, and shredding local skateparks.
short: Aaron Turner loves hacking on WebAssembly projects, cooking up dope beats, and shredding local skateparks.

name: Kate Pond
bio: Kate Pond is best known for her love of seeing things come together. As a three time coordinator/volunteer for CascadiaJS she has developed a collection of badass hoodies, and karaoke songs. She's excited to be giving back to the CascadiaJS community this year as well.
short: Kate Pond is a long-time CascadiaJS volunteer who loves her collection of hoodies and karaoke songs.

name: Jim Liu
bio:
Work: engineering manager @ StockX

Invest: pre/seed startup @ New Stack Venture

Volunteer: CascadiaJS conference, DWebSeattle Meetup
Born and Raise in Taiwan; Live in Seattle
short: EM @ StockX // Investor @ New Stack Ventures // Volunteer @ CascadiaJS + DWebSeattle // Born and raised in Taiwan

name: Kelsey Breseman
bio: Tlingit, forest person, engineer, activist. Environment, policy, & accountability @EnviroDGI. Tech/ethics/DWeb @ Starling Lab & @Data_Together. Traveler, adventurer, writer @ http://medium.com/@ifoundtheme
short: Tlingit, forest person, engineer, activist, traveler, adventurer & writer

name: Greg Bulmash
bio: Greg Bulmash is a novelist, coder, teacher, and speaker. A habitual volunteer, he's also organized over 150 STEM education events for kids with Seattle CoderDojo. He's Director of Developer Advocacy at Webscale Networks (as of this writing) and this is his 8th CascadiaJS.
short: Novelist, coder, teacher, and speaker and habitual volunteer who's organized over 150 STEM education events for kids with Seattle CoderDojo.
